code

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • code.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    A board for use in the game of MasterLabyrinth. Essentially a collection of Tile objects. It keeps track of the 49 tiles (a 7x7 grid) on the game board itself, plus the one "free" tile that is available for tile moves. This is an ArrayList implementation in which tiles are placed in ArrayList columns and these columns are placed in the underlying ArrayList of ArrayLists. Currently the board handles pathfinding as well, although this is likely to change in subsequent versions.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    team112

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(boolean fixed)
        Creates a board of Tiles. As of now, it has a parameter to set the board to a dynamic state (for playing) and a static state (for testing).
        Parameters:
        fixed - boolean representing the fixed or non-fixed state of the board upon creation

      • getTileLocation

        public java.awt.Point getTileLocation(code.Tile t)
        Given a specific Tile, returns the x,y coordinates of the tile on the board.
        Parameters:
        t - the tile whose location is desired.
        Returns:
        the x,y coordinates of the tile on the board as a Point object. If not found, returns Point(-1,-1)

      • findPath

        public void findPath(code.Tile t)
        Given a Tile t, generates a HashSet of Tiles that represents the legal moves available to a player. This method will be called on a player's turn, after their tile move, with the Tile that the Player is on.
        Parameters:
        t - the tile to find available paths from

      • getPathSize

        public int getPathSize()
        Accessor for size of current path.
        Returns:
        an int value corresponding to the size of the current path

        Returns:

      • shiftColumn

        public boolean shiftColumn(int col,
                           boolean top)
        Inserts the "free" tile into the designated column at either the top or bottom, and shifts the other values accordingly, generating a new free tile. Only allows shifts on odd numbered indices. Returns true if successful, false if unsuccessful.
        Parameters:
        col - int representing the column to shift
        top - boolean indicating whether the freetile is to be inserted at the "top" of the list

      • shiftRow

        public boolean shiftRow(int row,
                        boolean back)
        Inserts the "free" tile into the designated row at either the front or back, and shifts the other values accordingly, generating a new free tile. Only allows shifts on odd numbered indices. Returns true if successful, false if unsuccessful.
        Parameters:
        row - int representing the row to shift
        back - a boolean indicating whether the _freetile is inserted at the "back" of the list.
        Returns:

      • rotateFreeTile
